Name:
Hepatica
Hepatica
Builder: Davie Shipbuilding and Repairing Co. Ltd., Lauzon
Identification:
Pennant number: K159
Pennant number: K159
Fate:
Loaned to Canada 1941; returned 1945; scrapped 1948
Returned to the Royal Navy 27 June 1945.
Motto: Caveant Hostes Sub Mare Hepaticus Vigilat (Beware Enemy Under The Sea Hepatica Watches)
Propulsion:
Single shaft
2 × fire tube Scotch boilers
1 × 4-cycle triple-expansion reciprocating steam engine
2,750 ihp (2,050 kW)
Range: 3,500 nautical miles (6,482 km) at 12 knots (22.2 km/h)
processing systems:
1 × SW1C or 2C radar
1 × Type 123A or Type 127DV sonar
Armament:
1 × BL 4 in (102 mm) Mk.IX single gun
2 × .50 cal machine gun (twin)
2 × Lewis .303 cal machine gun (twin)
2 × Mk.II depth charge throwers
2 × Depth charge rails with 40 depth charges
Originally fitted with minesweeping gear, later removed
